result.execSummary:
The defendant Reighnn T Post-McNab was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reighnn T Post-McNab is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reighnn T Post-McNab was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 15CF261.  Credit for 166 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $2,304.31 plus surcharges (stipulated to by parties in 15CF261).
Perform 250 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with known felons or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Reighnn T Post-McNab, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments are made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  15CF261 and 15CF274 are concurrent.  Credit for 166 days if revoked.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 260 hours of Community Service.  Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Reighnn T Post-McNab, appeared with Attorney Cassi Baumgarnder specially for Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Court received email correspondence and Attu Rufo is ill and unable to appear.  Court grants one final adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing rescheduled to 5/5/16 at 11:00 AM and confirmed with Atty Rufo.
Atty Rufo is out ill today and ADA Trigg has no objection to rescheduling so hearing to be rescheduled and notice to be sent to parties.
Sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing rescheduled to 4/12/16 at 2PM pending confirmation from Atty Rufo.
Court has reviewed and approves Atty Rufo's request for adjournment with no objection by the State.
received from Atty Rufo requesting to reschedule Sentencing on 3/16/16 due to a Dr. appt.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Andrea Rufo.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Plea of guilty to Count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 3/16/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
No record made.  Case is resolved.  Plea hearing 1/19/16 at 8:30.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Johnson (for Atty A Rufo).  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Johnson states that Atty Rufo is out until 11/1/15.  Court adjourns JT to 1/19/16 at 8:30am, JSH continued to 1/14/16 at 1pm.  Bond continued.
